intro: Apodytes mauritiana, commonly known as the Madagascar elder or false hibiscus, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Apodytes mauritiana is often found in dry forests and coastal areas, adapting well to arid conditions.
